Patrick to business leaders: 'I'm not going anywhere'

In remarks to the Greater Boston Chamber of Commerce today, Governor Deval Patrick said he intends to complete his term in office. (Globe, 9:08 a.m.)
  • Patrick defends near-universal health care

Rhode Island governor, Curt Schilling meeting over 'issues' with 38 Studios

Governor Lincoln Chafee says he and state officials have been meeting with Schilling regarding finance issues with the ex-Sox pitcher's video game company 38 Studios. (AP, 8:33 a.m.)
  • 2/7 Schilling's 'Kingdoms of Amalur'

Bargain towns below $250,000

There are several towns in the Greater Boston area where houses are available for less than $250,000.

Failed talks in Greece mean new election

Greece will hold a new election in June after days of talks failed to resolve the country's political deadlock, party leaders said today. (AP, 10:30 a.m.)

After fall, insurers' auto rates up again

Auto insurance rates, which tumbled after Massachusetts opened the state to more competition four years ago, are marching steadily upward again. (Globe)

Warren’s heritage is Brown's focus

Elizabeth Warren's failure to offer a full and concise answer on her ancestry's role in her careeer has allowed questions from US Senator Scott Brown to linger. (Globe)

  • Brown asked to release fund-raising ties to JPMorgan

Opinion | Bob Ryan

Celtics couldn’t close

Game 2 was set up for another comeback victory, but the Celtics couldn’t impose their will on the 76ers, and now the series is heading to Philadelphia tied at 1-1.

House quietly moves to
reassign Chelsea District Court

The Mass. House leadership used a late-night budget amendment to place the Chelsea District Court under the auspices of Boston Municipal Court, long a target of patronage charges.
Opinion | Joanna Weiss

Barney Frank reflects on his journey

Monumental change has taken place over the course of the representative’s 40-year public career.

DeLeo wants firms to stay put

House Speaker Robert DeLeo unveiled a proposal to encourage the development of young tech companies and to urge innovative businesses to stay in Mass.

Warren seeks to refocus campaign

Elizabeth Warren is seizing on a $2 billion trading loss at JPMorgan Chase to steer her campaign toward comfortable territory: financial sector recklessness.
G Cover

Club tackles rugby with enthusiasm

Members of the Boston Rugby Football Club play for the love of competing, not the money. (There is none.)

Slowing the student ‘brain drain’

Public agencies and business groups have launched initiatives to connect students to internships and job programs, in an effort to keep them in the Boston area.

Female memory loss

New research is showing that memory does decline slightly during the early part of menopause, and there is a clear connection between memory and the hormone estrogen.
